programme.title: Dodo

When they get stuck on the notorious Hole 7 after countless attempts, Joe is convinced that they'll be stuck on Hole 7 forever until he starts getting mocked by two guys behind them and Hitesh comes to his defence - united by a common enemy, Joe and Hitesh start to get along. programme.title: The Only Way is Essex
programme.desc: Frankie is in turmoil after the shock of running into her ex Jack at the Halloween party - she thought they had ended on good terms, but she is deeply hurt by Jack denying everything she remembers him saying during their last encounter and intent on proving that she has the truth on her side. When Jack is confronted by the once-friendly Chloe Sims, will he stand firm with his own truth? Elsewhere, Chloe Brockett is keen to make it clear that things aren't always black and white having apologised for her insensitive text messages towards Frankie, but is this one step too far for her friendship with Amy? Meanwhile, Pete is working hard to regain best friend status with Chloe Sims and Diags and has finally organised a day of fun for the three of them, Diags unveils his long-anticipated billboard for Plumb Point, and Gatsby throws a party for his friends to celebrate Diwali that is the perfect place to play his latest musical offering, a bhangra song featuring his own vocal skills.

programme.title: The Only Way is Essex
programme.desc: The gang are going out with a bang as Chloe S, TOWIE's Queen of Essex, is turning 40, and Chloe is throwing a birthday gala to celebrate. Taking their inspiration from Hollywood's elite, there'll be enviable glamour and glitz galore at this swanky soiree... and drama of epic proportions. Chloe's milestone birthday is as extravagant as they come, but there's one VIP who will be missing it... Pete! Will he be able to pull out all the stops and make it up to her with a gift that she'll never forget? When Pete's away, Diags will play and give Chloe the best send-off to her 30s via her very own Chloe-inspired awards ceremony. As all her friends and family gather to show just how much she means to them, will she be able to make it through the night without a tear? Meanwhile, quiet boy Roman remains quiet no more - he's had enough of holding onto other people's secrets and decides that a birthday party is the best time to gift Dani and Gatsby some home truths about their relationship.

programme.title: The Only Way is Essex

Meanwhile, Lockie has brought his friend Jordan along on the trip and continues with big lifestyle changes including rebuilding his friendship with ex-girlfriend Yaz. Yaz also welcomes good friend Junaid, who is a well-known face in Essex, but where are his allegiances when it comes to his old friends Courtney, Chloe M and Amber? After back-to-back to fights with Billy, Amy is re-assessing their relationship and testing if absence really makes the heart grow fonder - she is also on hand to lend a sympathetic ear to Saff, who is about to turn 30 and is really not looking forward to this milestone birthday.

programme.title: Lethal Waters: Climate Change in Pakistan
programme.desc: The BBC followed the path of floods in Pakistan, from the mountains of the north to the plains of the south, and discovered a country trapped in an endless cycle of humanitarian crisis and recovery. The devastation takes different forms in every region, but there is one thing in common: the poorest are the ones paying the biggest price for global warming.

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: John Simpson, in discussion with the BBC's unparalleled range of experts across the world, analyses Donald Trump's approach to dealing with China, examines the United States' rivalry with China in South East Asia, and explores what the future holds for Benjamin Netanyahu and the Israeli government.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: AI Decoded
programme.desc: AI Decoded investigates the integration of artificial intelligence and drone technology and the real world impact happening today. AI powered drones are now used across a whole swathe of industries, whether it be on the battlefield, for agricultural purposes, search and rescue missions, delivery and logistics, the list goes on and on. In this episode, AI correspondent Marc Cieslak meets with UK Defence contractor BAE Systems who have recently developed a prototype AI drone that can be controlled using voice commands. In an exclusive for AI Decoded we trial the drone and discuss the implications this new AI development could mean for everyone.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Global Eye
programme.desc: A new weekly programme from the BBC World Service, bringing you forensic journalism from all corners of the world by BBC Eye, the World Services critically acclaimed investigative unit, and featuring expert global correspondents taking you to the heart of the biggest international stories. In this weeks episode we explore the rise of gen Z protests around the world. The Eye team uncovers what really happened during the popular youth uprising that led to the downfall of Bangladeshs former prime minister Sheikh Hasina. Sammy Awami is in Madagascar, where another wave of political unrest driven by gen Z anger and frustration toppled President Andry Rajoelina.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Ukrainecast
programme.desc: After an EU decision on the use of frozen Russian assets to aid Ukraine was postponed until December, discussion among European leaders returned to plans for a ceasefire this week. And the latest example of so-called nuclear 'sabre-rattling' by Vladimir Putin, forced Donald Trump to respond with a vague commitment of his own to resume US nuclear testing for the first time in decades. On this edition of Ukrainecast, Jamie Coomarasamy and Vitaly Shevchenko are joined by BBC Verify's Olga Robinson and senior digital journalist Laura Gozzi, to answer your questions. Could Denmark and Sweden police the Baltic Sea? What happened to the Russian dam targeted by Ukraine? And are Russians facing discrimination from authorities in Europe?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: Can Argentinas economic reforms make a lasting difference, and do they hold any lessons for the rest of the world? President Mileis latest election win gives him a mandate to continue with his sweeping spending cuts on everything from pensions and healthcare to fuel subsidies, but do they finally mean an end to years of economic crisis? Former head of Argentinas central bank Guido Sandleris explains the role of foreign trade and what it could mean for other parts of Latin America. Plus, the president of leading business lobby group the Institute for Business Development of Argentina, Santiago Mignone, tells Ben Thompson why the changes could bring the foreign investment that leads to sustainable growth.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: After two devastating years of war, there is now a fragile ceasefire in Gaza. But will it lead to a lasting peace? Panorama has had exclusive access to King Abdullah of Jordan a key player in the Middle East - as war has raged and as the ceasefire deal has taken shape. Jordan, which borders Israel and the occupied West Bank and has a large Palestinian population, has seen the crisis close up. Reporter Fergal Keane follows the king as he leads the evacuation of dozens of sick children from Gaza to hospitals in Jordan, and goes behind the scenes with him at the United Nations in New York as the outlines of a potential peace deal emerge. He also talks to the kings wife and closest confidante, Queen Rania. What does the future hold for Gaza and its children, and what hope is there now of a wider peace in the region?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: The Media Show
programme.desc: A row over comments by a British MP has reignited debate about who we see in adverts. Sara Denby from the University of Oxford and Dino Myers-Lamptey from The Barber Shop agency share their views on how the industry has changed. In the US, major streaming companies are merging as they compete for global audiences. Camilla Lewis, chief executive of Curve Media, explains what this could mean for both producers and viewers. Historian Bettany Hughes returns with Treasures of the World on Channel 4. She talks about filming around the globe, how history programmes are made today and why stories from the past still attract big audiences.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi visits Gorongosa National Park in Mozambique, where a stunning recovery in animal numbers has made it a remarkable safari destination once more. Emeline gets close to the animals, spending time with one of the park's vets, changing the GPS collar on a lion and taking a pangolin in her care for a walk, as well hearing about the impact the park's success has had on one of its youngest guides.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Napoleonic War-based action-adventure. Winter 1813 - Wellington is informed by the debonair Comte de Maquerre that Bordeaux is ready to rebel against Napoleon, but Wellington's spymaster Ross is suspicious and tests Maquerre by suggesting that they use Maquerre's own castle as a base. Maquerre reluctantly agrees but says that the castle is in Napoleon's hands, so Wellington appoints Colonel Bampfylde to lead the attack on the castle with Sharpe in support. Bampfylde, who is intent on glory, sends Sharpe on a scouting mission and tries to capture the castle on his own, but he fails and casualties are heavy - Sharpe, who is a witness to the carnage, therefore has Harris and Frederickson sneak into the castle in disguise, and they soon force the French to surrender once inside. Ashamed by Sharpe's victory, Bampfylde sends him off on a reconnaissance mission - however, Sharpe soon discovers that Bordeaux has no intention of rising against Napoleon and that Maquerre is a double agent.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Napoleonic War-based action-adventure. France 1813 - the war is entering its final stages and the French formulate a desperate plan to capture Wellington's spymaster Major General Ross. Sharpe is ordered by Wellington to accompany Colonel Brand, who is intent on destroying the French main powder supply in the caves of Rocha - Wellington and Ross are both suspicious of Brand's loyalty, but they do not reveal this to Sharpe. The suspicions are well-founded as Brand secretly meets the French and makes plans for capturing Ross - meanwhile, Sharpe's wife on the home front is showing signs of being bored with Army life and enjoys the attentions of a young poet.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Napoleonic War-based action-adventure. June 1813 - the South Essex is seriously short of men, and when the Duke of Wellington is told that there are no recruits available, he sends Sharpe to England to investigate. When Sharpe and Harper arrive, they are informed that there are 700 men waiting for them in Chelmsford - however, Sharpe finds the barracks deserted with no sign of his missing regiment. He and Harper decide to assume other identities and enlist - recruited by Sergeant Havercamp, Sharpe and Harper arrive at a training camp near the estate of Sir Henry Simmerson where they are trained mercilessly. Sharpe discovers that the new recruits are being auctioned to other regiments and returns to the Horse Guards with this information to entrust it to an old friend called Lawford... but Lawford wants to avoid a scandal and promptly tells Lord Fenner, who tries to have Sharpe killed. With the help of Fenner's mistress Lady Anne, Sharpe must now find the proof to implicate Fenner.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: This episode follows one woman searching for her Jamaican-born birth father and another on the hunt for the half-brother that her mother gave up for adoption after his American serviceman father went home and off the radar following the Second World War. In our first case, Rachel Burch grew up in a white family and stood out in the small West Sussex village where they lived - she turns to us for help finding her Jamaican-born birth father, but she's also yearning to find any family member whose lived experience has been like her own. Our second story concerns Sue Davis, whose mum had a baby boy from a relationship with an American soldier that she met working in a wartime canteen in Winchester - afraid of rejection, she asked Sue not to look for her son until after her death. Now, years later on from this request, Sue duly takes up the search on behalf of her late mother.

Mary is beginning to emerge from her grief and starts to take an interest in the running of the estate, but she meets resistance from her father - meanwhile, Bates comes up with a plan to help Molesley as his fortunes worsen, Lady Flintshire's daughter Lady Rose is out for some fun but finds herself in a sticky situation at a tea dance in York, and Mrs Hughes does her best to urge Mr Carson to allow an old wound to heal.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Widely acclaimed drama series about the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants. An extravagant house party at the Abbey gives the Crawleys a chance to reconnect with old friends, but some guests prove more welcome than others and skulduggery and heartache come along with the celebrations.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants. Mary faces a pressing question about her future amid the fallout from the eventful house party, Carson reveals surprisingly intimate details of his former life, and a trip to the bright lights of London sees Rose put the reputation of the Crawleys in jeopardy.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants. Change is in the air as an exciting opportunity for Alfred creates tension between Ivy and Daisy, Isobel's appeal to Violet's charitable nature comes with a fight, and Branson considers a new future for himself and baby Sybbie.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Crime drama series about the young Detective Constable Endeavour Morse. An unknown menace is stalking Oxford and striking fear into the hearts of its citizens - although the killer appears to be a deranged lunatic striking at random, Endeavour uncovers an underlying method to the madness where the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests that the killer shares Endeavour's passion for opera.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Members of the Midsomer-in-the-Marsh Ornithological Society fall out when one of them, Ralph Ford, claims that he has spotted a blue-crested hoopoe - the sighting puts him ahead in a list competition, but MMOS president Patrick Morgan says that the bird could never have been seen in Midsomer as it is native to Uganda. Ralph storms out of the meeting infuriated - the next day Patrick is found dead in Swansdown Lake, the scene of the alleged hoopoe sighting, and his body is pulled from the lake entangled in a mist net used to catch and release birds. The dead man's wife Nina, a former Russian prima ballerina, had recently become pregnant - before his death Patrick Morgan accused Nina of sleeping with another man and professed it to be impossible that she was pregnant. Was Patrick's obsession with ornithology really to blame for his death, or something more sinister? Barnaby and Jones attempt to discover the truth.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope is called to the tragic scene of an unidentified teenage boy found dead in a sleepy coastal town.

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: Drama based on real events. Nick teams up with the New York Times as Andy Coulson lands in Downing Street, and Dave Cook is challenged in court over the Morgan investigation. [SL,S,AD] S1 Ep5

programme.title: Cracker
programme.desc: Kelly is released into Fitz's care after a lack of evidence. But after another murdered woman is found, Kelly is arrested and DCI Bilborough orders Fitz off the case. Fitz and DS Penhaligan collude to find out the truth, while their relationship becomes more personal.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Enduring British sitcom about a bus driver and his conductor pal. Jack and the inspector attempt to fix a water heater.

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Feature-length drama following the exploits of the irascible Detective Inspector Frost. Frost has plenty on his plate when an MP's son is involved in a hit-and-run accident and a casino robbery takes place on the same night, but the crisis situation is exacerbated when a police officer goes missing and an armed robber turns up on his patch.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Drama series about a Cornish police detective. Wycliffe is summoned to trace a farmer who has disappeared.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Poirot is looking forward to Christmas on his own, but when the nation's security is threatened, the Foreign Office have a rather different interpretation of Season's Greetings.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Police drama series. Lewis and Hathaway enter the archaic world of St Gerard's Hall when a visiting female bishop is found dead after drinking poisoned wine. Was she was murdered because her liberal views contradicted those of the reactionary religious leaders of the college? When another two deaths occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, Lewis and Hathaway realise that the motive is much more convoluted.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Crime drama series about the young detective constable Endeavour Morse. Endeavour is sceptical when the death of a student is put down to a heart attack. Now based at Cowley station, he has is working for DI Thursday, though the new superintendent considers him too junior for the job. When the body of a GP is later discovered, Endeavour's theories get him sidelined to general duties, but he feels compelled to go out on a limb on another line of inquiry involving a physicist and a single mother.

programme.title: Goodnight Mister Tom
programme.desc: World War II drama in which a curmudgeonly widower living in a small village takes in a painfully shy evacuee from London. The widower soon realises that his young charge has been damaged both mentally and physically at the hands of his strict mother. He sets about undoing the damage, teaching the youngster to read, write and draw. But then the child is summoned back to the city.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones enter the cloistered and old-fashioned world of Midsomer Priory after a nun is found strangled - Jones visits the local pub and learns that a woman was seen acting strangely on the day of the murder and that teenagers in the area sneak into the priory grounds for romantic liaisons. The nuns then discover that a valuable silver altar set has vanished and that a chaplain has been murdered - can Barnaby and Jones work out the connection between the holy orders, the missing silver, and some African art while uncovering the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a farmer is found horribly murdered in the middle of a stone circle, suspicion points at a group of druids - DCI John Barnaby and DS Jones hurry to the scene of the crime and are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding on her first assignment. Druid high priest Leticia Clifford shows Barnaby that sacred ley lines run through the stone circle and is later convinced that she has made an exciting discovery - however, she is stabbed to death before she can share her theory. When a third body is then found, Barnaby starts to believe that basic human greed rather than spiritualism is the real motive for murder...

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the murder of a trainee forensic psychologist found dead on a Northumberland landfill site.

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Dead Land: When Alex takes time off following a family bereavement, Tony is partnered with the ambitious DI Andy Hall on a case involving murdered homeless men. [S,AD] S6 Ep12
